title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 28 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 28.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:1, how are the righteous described?
questions.correctAnswer: Bold as a lion
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:1 states that 'the righteous are bold as a lion,' contrasting them with the wicked who flee.

questions.question: What prolongs the state of a land according to Proverbs 28:2?
options: A man of understanding and knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: A man of understanding and knowledge
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:2 says that by a man of understanding and knowledge the state of a land shall be prolonged.

questions.question: In Proverbs 28:3, a poor man oppressing the poor is compared to what?
options: A sweeping rain which leaveth no food
questions.correctAnswer: A sweeping rain which leaveth no food
questions.explanation: Verse 3 compares a poor man oppressing the poor to a sweeping rain which leaves no food.

questions.question: Who praises the wicked according to Proverbs 28:4?
questions.correctAnswer: They that forsake the law
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:4 states that those who forsake the law praise the wicked.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:5, who understands all things?
questions.correctAnswer: They that seek the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 5 says that those who seek the LORD understand all things, unlike evil men who do not understand judgment.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 28:6 states it is better to be rich and perverse than poor and upright.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:6 actually states that it is better to be poor and walk in uprightness than to be rich and perverse.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:7, what happens to a son who keeps the law?
questions.correctAnswer: He is wise
questions.explanation: Verse 7 says that whoso keeps the law is a wise son.

questions.question: What is gathered for him that will pity the poor according to Proverbs 28:8?
options: Substance gained by usury and unjust gain
questions.correctAnswer: Substance gained by usury and unjust gain
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:8 explains that substance gained by usury and unjust gain shall be gathered for him that will pity the poor.

questions.question: What happens to the prayer of one who turns away from hearing the law according to Proverbs 28:9?
questions.correctAnswer: It is an abomination
questions.explanation: Verse 9 states that the prayer of one who turns away his ear from hearing the law shall be an abomination.

questions.question: Who shall fall into his own pit according to Proverbs 28:10?
options: He that causeth the righteous to go astray
questions.correctAnswer: He that causeth the righteous to go astray
questions.explanation: Verse 10 teaches that he who causes the righteous to go astray shall fall into his own pit.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 28:13 says that covering sins leads to prosperity.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:13 states that covering sins will not prosper, but confessing and forsaking them will bring mercy.

questions.question: What is the result for the man that feareth always, according to Proverbs 28:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Happy
questions.explanation: Verse 14 says that happy is the man that feareth always.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 28:18 says the perverse will be saved.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:18 states that the perverse in their ways shall fall at once, whereas the upright shall be saved.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Proverbs 28:27: 'He that giveth unto the poor shall not _____.'
questions.correctAnswer: lack
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:27 says 'He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:28, what happens when the wicked rise?
questions.correctAnswer: Men hide themselves
questions.explanation: Verse 28 explains that when the wicked rise, men hide themselves, but when they perish, the righteous increase.

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 28 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is afraid to stand firm in faith under pressure. Based on Proverbs 28, what biblical truth would you share about boldness?
options: The righteous are bold as a lion
questions.correctAnswer: The righteous are bold as a lion
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:1 teaches that the righteous are bold as a lion, showing that faith and righteousness produce courage and confidence. Additionally, Proverbs 28:14 shows the blessing of fearing God, and Proverbs 28:26 contrasts trusting in self with wisdom from God.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 28 teach about the importance of obedience to God's law in family life?
options: Keeping the law makes one a wise son
Ignoring the law brings honor to parents
Law is irrelevant to family relationships
questions.correctAnswer: Keeping the law makes one a wise son
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:7 states that keeping the law makes one a wise son, while associating with riotous men shames the father. This highlights how obedience to God's Word honors family and promotes wisdom. Proverbs 28:13 also shows confession and forsaking sin brings mercy, important in family reconciliation.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28, what is a practical outcome for those who confess and forsake their sins?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall have mercy
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:13 clearly states that confessing and forsaking sins results in receiving mercy. This illustrates God's grace and the importance of repentance. Related verses include Proverbs 28:9 about turning away from hearing the law causing prayer to be abomination, emphasizing obedience and confession.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with trust in their own understanding rather than God. What does Proverbs 28 say about trusting in one’s own heart?
options: Trusting in your own heart makes you a fool
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting in your own heart makes you a fool
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:26 warns that trusting in one’s own heart is foolishness, whereas walking wisely leads to deliverance. This teaches humility and reliance on God's guidance. Proverbs 28:16 also contrasts understanding with oppression, highlighting godly wisdom.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28 teach about generosity and caring for the poor?
options: Giving to the poor ensures one will not lack
Hiding eyes from the poor brings many blessings
questions.correctAnswer: Giving to the poor ensures one will not lack
questions.explanation: According to Proverbs 28:27, giving to the poor results in having no lack, while ignoring them brings curses. Proverbs 28:8 also teaches that unjust gains will ultimately benefit the poor, underscoring God's justice and blessing on generosity.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 28 describe the consequences of hardening one’s heart toward God’s fear?
options: Such a person will fall into mischief
They will prosper in all things
questions.correctAnswer: Such a person will fall into mischief
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:14 contrasts the happy man who fears God always with the one who hardens his heart, who falls into mischief. This emphasizes the protective and guiding role of reverence toward God in practical Christian living.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28 teach about the integrity of the poor who walk uprightly compared to the rich who are perverse?
options: The poor upright are better than the rich perverse
The rich perverse are better than the poor upright
questions.correctAnswer: The poor upright are better than the rich perverse
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:6 emphasizes that a poor man who walks in uprightness is better than a rich man who is perverse. This teaches that moral integrity is more valuable than wealth. Proverbs 28:11 also highlights that understanding is better than riches.

questions.question: True or False: According to Proverbs 28, when the wicked rise, people rejoice openly.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:12 states that when righteous men rejoice, there is great glory, but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden. This shows that wickedness causes fear and hiding rather than joy.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to seek quick riches. What warning does Proverbs 28 give about this attitude?
options: Hastening to be rich leads to innocence loss
questions.correctAnswer: Hastening to be rich leads to innocence loss
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:20 warns that a faithful man abounds with blessings, but one who hastens to be rich will not be innocent. This teaches patience, integrity, and faithfulness as keys to blessing.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28 say about the consequences of turning away from hearing the law?
options: Their prayer shall be an abomination
questions.correctAnswer: Their prayer shall be an abomination
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:9 teaches that turning away the ear from hearing the law causes one’s prayer to become an abomination, stressing the importance of obedience in prayer life and personal devotion.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 28 describe a wicked ruler’s impact on the poor?
options: Like a roaring lion and ranging bear
questions.correctAnswer: Like a roaring lion and ranging bear
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:15 compares a wicked ruler over poor people to a roaring lion and ranging bear, illustrating oppression and fear, highlighting the harm of ungodly leadership.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "He that covereth his sins shall not _________; but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy."
questions.correctAnswer: prosper
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:13 says covering sins prevents prosperity, while confession and forsaking sin bring mercy, teaching repentance's role in spiritual well-being.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28, what happens when a man tills his land faithfully?
options: He will have plenty of bread
questions.correctAnswer: He will have plenty of bread
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:19 teaches that diligent work leads to abundance, contrasting the poor who follow vain persons and become impoverished. This encourages a strong work ethic and integrity.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 28 teaches that a man who gives rebuke will find more favor than one who flatters with the tongue.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:23 states that rebuking a man leads to more favor than flattering with the tongue, emphasizing honest correction as a form of love and wisdom.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 28 describe the fate of a man who commits violence against another’s blood?
options: He shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him
questions.correctAnswer: He shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:17 teaches that a man who commits violent bloodshed will flee to the pit and no one should stop him, showing the certainty of judgment for such sin.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 28.

questions.question: What is the literary contrast presented in Proverbs 28:1 regarding the behavior of the wicked and the righteous?
options: The wicked flee without pursuit; the righteous are bold as a lion
The wicked are bold; the righteous hide like a lamb
The wicked are fearful; the righteous are cautious
The wicked pursue; the righteous flee
questions.correctAnswer: The wicked flee without pursuit; the righteous are bold as a lion
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:1 contrasts the fearfulness of the wicked who flee even when no one pursues them with the confidence of the righteous who are bold as a lion, highlighting a moral and psychological dichotomy.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:2, what prolongs the state of a land despite many princes?
options: A man of understanding and knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: A man of understanding and knowledge
questions.explanation: Verse 2 emphasizes that despite many rulers (princes) in a land, it is the leadership of a man with understanding and knowledge that prolongs the state's stability, reflecting the biblical theme of wise leadership found also in Ecclesiastes 10:16-17.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 28:4 describe those who forsake the law in relation to the wicked?
questions.correctAnswer: They praise the wicked
questions.explanation: The verse states that those who abandon the law end up praising the wicked, showing a literary antithesis between law-keepers who contend with evil and law-forsakers who support it.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28:5 suggest about the understanding of judgment between evil men and those who seek the LORD?
options: Evil men do not understand judgment; those who seek the LORD understand all things
Evil men understand judgment better than the righteous
Both evil men and those who seek the LORD understand judgment equally
Those who seek the LORD misunderstand judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Evil men do not understand judgment; those who seek the LORD understand all things
questions.explanation: This verse draws a parallel between spiritual insight and moral judgment, declaring that evil men lack true understanding, while those who seek God comprehend all things, echoing themes from Psalm 111:10.

questions.question: Which Hebrew literary device is evident in Proverbs 28:6 comparing a poor upright man to a rich perverse man?
questions.correctAnswer: Antithetical parallelism
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts two opposing characters—one poor but upright, the other rich but perverse—showing antithetical parallelism, a common device in Hebrew poetry used to highlight moral opposites.

questions.question: What is the consequence mentioned in Proverbs 28:9 for turning away from hearing the law?
options: His prayer shall be an abomination
questions.correctAnswer: His prayer shall be an abomination
questions.explanation: Turning away from the law leads to a rejection of prayer itself, as the verse states prayers become abominable, reflecting the theological theme of obedience as prerequisite for acceptable worship (cf. Isaiah 1:15).

questions.question: Proverbs 28:13 highlights the importance of confessing and forsaking sins. What does it say will happen to such a person?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall have mercy
questions.explanation: The verse teaches that concealing sin leads to failure, but confessing and abandoning sin brings mercy, paralleling Psalm 32:5 and emphasizing repentance’s role in divine forgiveness.

questions.question: True or False: According to Proverbs 28:14, a man who hardens his heart will fall into mischief.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:14 states that continual fear (reverence) leads to happiness, whereas hardening the heart results in downfall, underlining the biblical theme of the fear of the Lord as protective.

questions.question: In Proverbs 28:15, what imagery is used to describe a wicked ruler over poor people?
options: A roaring lion and a ranging bear
questions.correctAnswer: A roaring lion and a ranging bear
questions.explanation: The verse employs fierce animal metaphors—lion and bear—to depict the destructive nature of wicked rulers, a common Near Eastern metaphor for ferocity and oppression.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28:18 say about the fate of one who walks uprightly versus one who is perverse?
options: The upright shall be saved; the perverse shall fall at once
Both the upright and perverse shall prosper
The perverse shall be saved; the upright shall fall
The upright shall fall; the perverse shall rise
questions.correctAnswer: The upright shall be saved; the perverse shall fall at once
questions.explanation: This verse contrasts salvation for the upright with sudden ruin for the perverse, reflecting the wisdom motif of moral retribution present in the entire book of Proverbs.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:19, what is the result for one who tills his land compared to one who follows vain persons?
options: He shall have plenty of bread; poverty shall come to the follower
The follower shall be rich; the tiller shall be poor
questions.correctAnswer: He shall have plenty of bread; poverty shall come to the follower
questions.explanation: The verse utilizes agricultural metaphor to teach diligence leads to provision, while following worthless people results in poverty, a theme consistent with Proverbs 10:4.

questions.question: What warning does Proverbs 28:22 give about hastening to be rich?
options: It causes an evil eye and leads to poverty
questions.correctAnswer: It causes an evil eye and leads to poverty
questions.explanation: This verse uses the phrase 'evil eye' to describe greed and impatience for wealth, warning that it ultimately results in poverty, reflecting the biblical principle against covetousness (Luke 12:15).

questions.question: Which verse in Proverbs 28 highlights the theme of impartiality and its moral danger?
options: To have respect of persons is not good; for for a piece of bread that man will transgress
The wicked flee when no man pursueth
He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack
A faithful man shall abound with blessings
questions.correctAnswer: To have respect of persons is not good; for for a piece of bread that man will transgress
questions.explanation: Verse 21 warns against partiality or favoritism, explaining it leads to moral failure even for trivial gain, a theme also addressed in James 2:1-4.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28:26 say about trusting in one’s own heart versus walking wisely?
options: Trusting in one’s own heart is folly; walking wisely leads to deliverance
Trusting one’s heart leads to wisdom; walking wisely leads to folly
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting in one’s own heart is folly; walking wisely leads to deliverance
questions.explanation: This verse contrasts self-reliance with wisdom, teaching that human heart trust without God is foolishness, while wise conduct brings salvation, echoing themes in Jeremiah 17:9.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:27, what is the blessing promised to one who gives to the poor?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not lack
questions.explanation: The verse promises provision for those generous to the poor, contrasting with curses on those who ignore need, reinforcing the biblical ethic of charity (cf. Deuteronomy 15:7-11).

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 28 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:1, how do the righteous behave compared to the wicked?
options: The righteous are bold as a lion, while the wicked flee when no man pursueth.
The righteous flee in fear, while the wicked are confident.
Both the righteous and wicked are bold in their ways.
The wicked are bold as a lion, while the righteous hide.
questions.correctAnswer: The righteous are bold as a lion, while the wicked flee when no man pursueth.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:1 contrasts the confident boldness of the righteous with the fearful flight of the wicked. This aligns with Psalms 27:1 where the LORD is a stronghold of confidence and 2 Timothy 1:7 which states God gave us a spirit of power and love, not fear. Similarly, Revelation 21:8 shows the fate of the wicked contrasted with the boldness of the saints.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28:5 say about those who seek the LORD?
options: They are often confused about judgment.
questions.correctAnswer: They understand all things.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:5 teaches that those who seek the LORD have understanding of judgment and truth, contrasting with evil men who do not. This reflects Isaiah 11:2 where the Spirit of the LORD gives wisdom and understanding, and 1 Corinthians 2:16 where believers have the mind of Christ. James 1:5 also encourages seeking God's wisdom.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 28:6 states that better is the poor who __________ in his uprightness than the rich who is perverse in his ways.
questions.correctAnswer: walketh
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:6 highlights the value of integrity over wealth, emphasizing that walking in uprightness is superior to riches gained through perversity. This aligns with Psalm 37:16, Matthew 6:19-21 which values treasures in heaven, and 1 Timothy 6:6 which teaches godliness with contentment is great gain.

questions.question: What consequence does Proverbs 28:9 say will come upon a person who turns away from hearing the law?
options: His prayer shall be an abomination.
He will be honored among men.
questions.correctAnswer: His prayer shall be an abomination.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:9 warns that ignoring God's law leads to prayers that are detestable to God, reflecting God's holiness and the need for obedience. Isaiah 1:15 speaks of God refusing to hear the prayers of the rebellious, and 1 Peter 3:12 affirms God’s ears are attentive to the righteous but turn away from the wicked.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:13, what is the result of confessing and forsaking sins?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall have mercy.
questions.explanation: This verse teaches that confession and repentance lead to mercy, echoing themes found in 1 John 1:9 about God’s forgiveness, Psalm 32:5 where David describes forgiveness after confession, Isaiah 55:7 calling the wicked to forsake their ways for mercy, and Luke 15:7 where God rejoices over repentant sinners.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28:15 compare a wicked ruler to?
options: A roaring lion and a ranging bear.
A gentle dove and a still river.
A wise serpent and a strong oak.
A bright star and a calm sea.
questions.correctAnswer: A roaring lion and a ranging bear.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:15 likens a wicked ruler to dangerous wild animals that cause fear and destruction. This imagery illustrates the oppression of the innocent and is consistent with Psalm 10:9-10 which describes the wicked as a lion seeking prey and Ezekiel 22:25 lamenting corrupt rulers. Jesus refers to wolves and lions as metaphors for evil leaders in Matthew 7:15.

questions.question: Proverbs 28:18 states that the one who walks uprightly will be saved, but what happens to the one who is perverse in his ways?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall fall at once.
questions.explanation: This verse underscores the biblical principle of righteousness leading to salvation and perversion leading to downfall, aligning with Proverbs 11:31 about the destiny of the righteous and wicked, Psalm 1:6 which contrasts the path of the righteous and sinners, and Galatians 6:7 on reaping what one sows.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28:20 say about the man who hastens to be rich?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not be innocent.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:20 warns that eagerness for wealth can compromise innocence, echoing Ecclesiastes 5:10 about the vanity of loving money, 1 Timothy 6:9-10 about the dangers of desiring riches, and James 5:1-6 condemning the injustice of those who pursue wealth unrighteously.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:22, what is the attitude of one who hastens to be rich?
questions.correctAnswer: He hath an evil eye.
questions.explanation: This verse describes the greedy person as having an 'evil eye,' indicating envy or greed, which leads to poverty. This imagery is consistent with Luke 6:45 on the heart's evil producing evil deeds, Mark 7:22 listing covetousness as evil, and Hebrews 13:5 encouraging contentment over greed.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28:27 promise to the one who gives to the poor?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not lack.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:27 affirms God's blessing on generosity towards the poor, reflecting Deuteronomy 15:10 about generous giving, Luke 6:38 which promises blessings in return, Acts 20:35 quoting Jesus saying 'It is more blessed to give than to receive,' and 2 Corinthians 9:6-7 on cheerful giving.

questions.question: Who does Proverbs 28:24 describe as a companion of a destroyer?
options: One who robs his father or mother and says it is no transgression.
One who honors his parents and obeys the law.
One who gives generously to the poor.
One who seeks wisdom and understanding.
questions.correctAnswer: One who robs his father or mother and says it is no transgression.
questions.explanation: This verse condemns those who disrespect their parents and deny wrongdoing, equating them with destruction. This aligns with Exodus 20:12 on honoring parents, Ephesians 6:2-3 which promises blessing for this, and Proverbs 20:20 warning against cursing one's parents.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:26, how is the person described who trusts in his own heart?
questions.correctAnswer: A fool.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:26 teaches that self-reliance without God is folly, consistent with Jeremiah 17:9 on the deceitfulness of the heart, Proverbs 3:5-6 urging trust in the LORD rather than self, and Romans 10:3 cautioning against relying on human wisdom.

questions.question: What happens when the wicked rise, according to Proverbs 28:12 and 28:28?
questions.correctAnswer: Men hide themselves.
questions.explanation: Both verses describe fear and concealment when the wicked rise, contrasting with the flourishing of the righteous. This theme appears in Psalm 37:1-2 about not fretting because of evildoers, Isaiah 26:20 about hiding until God's wrath passes, and Luke 21:36 urging watchfulness before the Lord’s coming.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 28:2 teach about the leadership of a land?
options: A man of understanding and knowledge prolongs the state thereof.
Princes cause the land to perish.
questions.correctAnswer: A man of understanding and knowledge prolongs the state thereof.
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes wise leadership as key to national stability, consistent with Psalm 72:1-4 about a king who judges with righteousness, Romans 13:1-4 on governing authorities as God's servants, and 1 Timothy 2:1-2 urging prayers for leaders for peace.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:7, what is the consequence for one who is a companion of riotous men?
questions.correctAnswer: He shameth his father.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:7 shows that following sinful companions brings shame to one’s family, reflecting Proverbs 13:20 about companions influencing character, 1 Corinthians 15:33 warning against bad company, and Ephesians 5:11 exhorting believers to avoid the fruitless works of darkness.
